intro: Heisteria rigida, commonly known as the rigid heister, is a member of the Primulaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its upright, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, blooming in the spring. Heisteria rigida is native to Central America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
